customer_reviews.title: Its USB connector will break
customer_reviews.text: Not "if," but "when." The micro-USB shell will stay firmly mounted to the soldered through-holes, but the plastic core and its five SMD leads will break loose from the pads. It's easy to replace the board which is marked with Nvidia part no. 180-81646-1002-A05, but there is no source for this little PCB other than buying a whole new tablet. Reflowing (i.e. resoldering) its microscopic 0.65 mm pitch pads might be possible, but so far I've had little luck with them. To avoid this, one could attach a short micro-USB cable extension or adapter and gaffer-tape the cable to the back of the tablet.
